There's a fun core gameplay loop, but the game seems to pride itself on NOT giving you information mid-match. This makes the learning experience AND playing experience piss-poor. 

I've never before played a quote, unquote, "competitive game", where the CHARACTERS, ABILITIES, AND MAPS are all DELIBERATELY not told to the player before the game begins.

Imagine playing a hero shooter such as Apex, or a platform fighter like Smash Bros., where upon entering the match, you have absolutely NO IDEA what attacks and skills the other characters have until they use them - and you also don't know who you're fighting against! Even in League's "Ultimate Spellbook" mode they fucking TELL YOU EXPLICITLY what Ultimate the enemies and your friends have!!! 

Most, if not almost all competitive games are good about providing information to the player and telling them what things do, what people do. Care is put in to ensure that players understand, and can recognize one thing from another. 

Not in this game! 

You get to wonder who you're playing against! 
What skills your allies have! 
Where you're going to play! 
What places the objectives are located!

That's right! On top of all of that, not only are maps RANDOMIZED, but the map pool is also fucking random! You have to use a consumable to make getting a certain map more likely!

Wow!

If you can get past all the jank, the dumb bullshit, the game deliberately taking every opportunity to make learning it and playing it feel more random than Mario Party, and having to grind out tens of hours just to be able to get a viable competitive build going, then there is genuinely a good game here.

Do I recommend it? 

No.

I am upvoting this game because all in all it is a fun experience but its not without its flaws. The learning curve is a bit steep, and you're going to feel frustrated as hell trying to figure out how to beat survivors as a killer, then you'll swap to survivor just to get hooked 3 times and lose in the first 5 minutes of the game. But take what you learn each match and try to get better. There is no better feeling than dumpstering survivors as they scramble around to keep up, as you win while only 1 generator is complete. It also feels amazing to dip dive and dodge around the killer, saving your friends and having you all escape together as the killer stands at the escape, malding. And remember, like with all games, if you get frustrated you should take a break. Best of luck out there killers and survivors. (I also want to state that I'm grateful that the character packs aren't more expensive. I got the few characters from the franchises I like, and it didn't break the bank.)

edit: I am leaving the compliments above, but now that I have more experience with the game, I cannot in good conscience recommend others buy the game in its current state. The state of the community is so very very very toxic, and nobody wants to do anything about it. Survivors will body block you so you can't escape even though you're on the same team. If the survivors win, 100% of games they will stall at the gate to waste the killers time. If the killer wins, they'll also taunt and waste time to rub it in. If you ever EVER mention this in any discords or forums, it just gets discounted as "Who cares about your time, everybody does it, get over it." This is the mentality of the community, and there is no reason not to because there is never any repercussions. This game truly is only good if you're playing in a premade with friends, but then it become nearly impossible for the killer, and they dont get to have any fun. I am sorry, the game has so much potential but its clear that the game is destroying itself from the inside. I won't go into the weeds about the awful release schedule, perk bloat or other gameplay related problems because sooo many others have already touched on it. So final review, don't buy.

I have over 1000 hours clocked in for this game, I dont think I can recommend it enough. Its a amazing game that incorporates teamwork, skill, strategy and coordination in order to advance. Its a game that you'll play for hours and hours on end and you wont regret paying for all the DLC's either. DBD has been a great game i've played for years and I dont plan on stopping anytime soon (although i've uninstalled out of rage several times)
